description.narrative: Output 025: Social Protection: The social protection system is strengthened through improving key features and elements that define the effectiveness, efficiency and reach of interventions (particularly LEAP) and supporting policy development, policy relevant research and policy advocacy., which contributes to Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: Social Protection and C4D: Vulnerable and marginalized families with children across Ghana access and utilize improved social services and are empowered to adopt key family practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 025: Social Protection: The social protection system is strengthened through improving key features and elements that define the effectiveness, efficiency and reach of interventions (particularly LEAP) and supporting policy development, policy relevant research and policy advocacy.

description.narrative: A costed implementation plan for the national Social Protection Policy was drafted. UNICEF directly supported identification of an additional 94,000 LEAP households for LEAP. A media blitz with international experts on social protection was held in March. LEAP's Management Information System benefited from a new module. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: High level policy coordination and monitoring arrangements (inter-ministerial committee, policy framework) for social protection interventions in place (policy approved by the cabinet) and functioning (inter-ministerial and technical committee meet regularly)

baseline.value: Baseline: No inter-ministerial committee, no policy framework

target.value: 2017:Indicator is YES if policy framework is approved by the cabinet, and the committee meets at least once a year (starting in 2015).

title.narrative: An M&E framework for LEAP is regularly producing monitoring reports (Quarterly or Biannual Reports, Independent Monitoring Checks -2 years only- and Annual Reports)

baseline.value: Baseline: No regular monitoring (Quarterly or Biannual Reports, Independent Monitoring Checks -2 years only- and Annual Reports)

target.value: 2017:Indicator is YES if: ALL quarterly or Biannual reports and annual report (from mid 2014), and bi-annual spot check (for the period 2015-2017 only) are produced.

actual.value: 2017:LEAP has continued to produce quarterly reports, adjustments to report content and format are ongoing to improve the usefulness for management and performance tracking.

title.narrative: 2.2 Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy
2.8 M and E: Monitoring and evaluation mechanisms are used to follow up on social protection delivery/system
